post.description:
This operation creates a product order entity. Mandatory and non mandatory attributes, additional rules and default values are provided in the specifications document.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in

HTTP Response 422 Unprocessable entity

400.description:
Bad Request

List of supported error codes:
- 20: Invalid URL parameter value
- 21: Missing body
- 22: Invalid body
- 23: Missing body field
- 24: Invalid body field
- 25: Missing header
- 26: Invalid header value
- 27: Missing query-string parameter
- 28: Invalid query-string parameter value

401.description:
Unauthorized

List of supported error codes:
- 40: Missing credentials
- 41: Invalid credentials
- 42: Expired credentials

403.description:
Forbidden

List of supported error codes:
- 50: Access denied
- 51: Forbidden requester
- 52: Forbidden user
- 53: Too many requests

404.description:
Not Found

List of supported error codes:
- 60: Resource not found

500.description:
Internal Server Error

List of supported error codes:
- 1: Internal error

503.description:
Service Unavailable

List of supported error codes:
- 5: The service is temporarily unavailable
- 6: Orange API is over capacity, retry later !

patch.description:
This    operation    allows    partial    updates    of    a    product    order    entity.    Support    of    json/merge (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7386)  is  mandatory,  support  of  json/patch  (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5789)  is optional.
Patchable and not patchable attributes are provided in the specifications document.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the general type and/or category of the hardware item. This, in combination with the Part and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

parameters.name: part
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that defines a manufacturer-allocated part number assigned by the organization that manufactures the hardware item. This, in combination with the Model and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that defines the manufacturer-allocated Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number of the hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that defines the name of the manufacturer. This, in combination with the Model and the Part, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute for a physical resource.

Service Unavailable

- 5: The service is temporarily unavailable
- 6: Orange API is over capacity, retry later !

TMF620ProductOffering.description: Represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the productOffering

isBundle.description: isBundle determines whether a productOffering represents a single productOffering (false), or a bundle of productOfferings (true).

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

validFor.description: The period for which the productOffering is valid

@type.description: Class type of the product offering

@baseType.description: Immediate base (class) type of the product offering

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this product offering

isSellable.description: A flag indicating if this product offer can be sold stand-alone for sale or not. If this flag is false it indicates that the offer can only be sold within a bundle.

TMF620ImportJob.description: Represents a task used to import resources from a file

id.description: Identifier of the import job

contentType.description: Indicates the format of the imported data

TMF620Catalog.description:
The root entity for entity catalog management. An entity catalog can be defined as a collection of entity catalog items and arranging them in a particular manner based on the need.
In comparison to Product, Service and Resource catalogs, the entity catalog is intended for the purpose of providing any SID entity to consumers via a catalog, with its specification and policy providing governance over its content. Even Entity catalog may have an overlap with Product, Service or Resource catalog, it doesn't replace them. It is primarily intended to address those SID entities which may not be addressed by any of Product, Service or Resource catalog.
An entity catalog comprises of a list of RootEntities made available through EntityCatalogItems. This API addresses only RootEntity extended items as EntitySpecification. An entity catalog typically includes name, description and time period that it is valid for.

id.description: Unique identifier of the Catalog

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of catalog. For entity catalogs, this will be 'EntityCatalog'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: Indicates the base (class) type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which the catalog is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

TMF620ProductOfferingPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that is asked for or allowed when a ProductOffering is bought, rented, or leased. The price is valid for a defined period of time and may not represent the actual price paid by a customer.

id.description: unique id of this resource

validFor.description: The period for which the productOfferingPrice is valid

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

unitOfMeasure.description: A number and unit representing how many (for instance 1 dozen) of an ProductOffering is available at the offered price. Its meaning depends on the priceType. It could be a price, a rate, or a discount.

recurringChargePeriodType.description:
The period to repeat the application of the price
Could be month, week...

recurringChargePeriodLength.description: the period of the recurring charge:  1, 2, ... .It sets to zero if it is not applicable

@type.description: The class type of this Product offering

@baseType.description: the immediate base class type of this product offering

@schemaLocation.description: hyperlink reference to the schema describing this resource

lastUpdate.description: the last update time of this POP

isBundle.description: A flag indicating if this POP is composite (bundle) or not

lifecycleStatus.description: the lifecycle status of this POP

price.description: The amount of money that characterizes the price.

TMF620TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

TMF620PlaceRef.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

id.description: Unique identifier of the place

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as "Paris Store", "London Store", "Main Home"

geoLocationUrl.description: A url providing a map for localizing the place

address.description: A string characterizing an address (for instance a formatted address or an identifier taken from an address database or an address API).

@referredType.description: class type of the referred Place object

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'home delivery', 'shop retrieval')

TMF620SLARef.description: ServiceLevelAgreement reference: A service level agreement (SLA) is a type of agreement that represents a formal negotiated agreement between two parties designed to create a common understanding about products, services, priorities, responsibilities, and so forth. The SLA is a set of appropriate procedures and targets formally or informally agreed between parties in order to achieve and maintain specified Quality of Service.

id.description: Unique identifier of service level agreement

href.description: Reference of the service level agreement

name.description: Name of the service level agreement

@referredType.description: class type of referred Service Level Agreement

TMF620ProductSpecificationRef.description: Product specification reference: A ProductSpecification is a detailed description of a tangible or intangible object made available externally in the form of a ProductOffering to customers or other parties playing a party role.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product specification

@referredType.description: class type of referred Product Specification

TMF620ChannelRef.description: Channel reference. The channel defines the channel for selling product offerings.

id.description: Unique identifier of the channel

@referredType.description: (Class) type of the referred channel like DistributionChannel, SalesChannel and so on

TMF620ServiceCandidateRef.description: ServiceCandidate reference. ServiceCandidate is an entity that makes a ServiceSpecification available to a catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier of the service candidate

href.description: Unique reference of the service candidate

@referredType.description: The Class type of  referred Service Candidate

TMF620Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

id.description: Unique identifier of the attachment

type.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

@type.description: the class type of the Attachment

@baseType.description: The immediate base class type of the attachment

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this attachment entity

TMF620CategoryRef.description: Category reference. The category resource is used to group product offerings, service and resource candidates in logical containers. Categories can contain other categories and/or product offerings, resource or service candidates.

id.description: Unique reference of the category

@referredType.description: the class type of the referred Category

TMF620ResourceCandidateRef.description: ResourceCandidate reference: A resource candidate is an entity that makes a ResourceSpecification available to a catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource candidate

@referredType.description: The Class type of referred Resource Candidate

TMF620ProductOfferingTerm.description: A condition under which a ProductOffering is made available to Customers. For instance, a productOffering can be offered with multiple commitment periods.

validFor.description: The period for which the productOfferingterm is valid

@type.description: The class type of ProductOfferingTerm

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this product offering term

TMF620MarketSegmentRef.description: provides references to the corresponding market segment as target of product offerings. A market segment is grouping of Parties, GeographicAreas, SalesChannels, and so forth.

id.description: Unique identifier of the market segment

@referredType.description: (Class) type of the referred market segment

TMF620AgreementRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

id.description: Identifier of the agreement

@referredType.description: class type of the referred Agreement

TMF620BundledProductOffering.description: A type of ProductOffering that belongs to a grouping of ProductOfferings made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductOffering.

id.description: Unique identifier of the BundledProductOffering

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

TMF620ProdSpecCharValueUse.description: A use of the ProdSpecCharacteristicValue by a ProductOffering to which additional properties (attributes) apply or override the properties of similar properties contained in ProdSpecCharacteristicValue. It should be noted that characteristics which their value(s) addressed by this object must exist in corresponding product specification. The available characteristic values for a ProductSpecCharacteristic in a Product specification can be modified at the ProductOffering level. For example, a characteristic 'Color' might have values White, Blue, Green, and Red. But, the list of values can be restricted to e.g. White and Blue in an associated product offering. It should be noted that the list of values in 'ProdSpecCharValueUse' is a strict subset of the list of values as defined in the corresponding product specification characteristics.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the productSpecCharacteristic is

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

validFor.description: The period for which the productSpecCharacteristic is valid

TMF620Quantity.description: A base / value and unit  used to represent quantity

amount.description: A quantity of something, typically the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, extent, or money.

units.description: The unit of measure for the quantity, such as meters, cubic yards, kilograms [ISO 80000], and the currency referring to [ISO 4217].

TMF620Price.description: Provides all amounts (tax included, duty free, tax rate), used currency and percentage to apply for Price Alteration.

taxIncludedAmount.description: All taxes included amount (expressed in the given currency)

dutyFreeAmount.description: All taxes excluded amount (expressed in the given currency)

TMF620PriceAlteration.description: Is an amount, usually of money, that modifies the price charged for an order item.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Monthly discount"

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this order item price alteration

priceType.description: A category that describes the price such as recurring, one time and usage.

applicationDuration.description: Duration during which the alteration applies on the order item price (for instance 2 months free of charge for the recurring charge)

priority.description: Priority level for applying this alteration among all the defined alterations on the order item price

priceCondition.description: Condition that triggers the price application

validFor.description: The period for which the price alteration is valid

TMF620Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

TMF620BundledProdOfferOption.description: A set of numbers that specifies the lower and upper limits for a ProductOffering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering. Values can range from 0 to unbounded

numberRelOfferLowerLimit.description: lower limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferUpperLimit.description: upper limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferDefault.description: Default number of produc offereings that should be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

TMF620ProductSpecCharacteristicValue.description: A number or text that can be assigned to a ProductSpecCharacteristic.

isDefault.description: Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

validFor.description: The period of time for which a value is applicable

value.description: A discrete value that the characteristic can take on. the value type is defined by 'valueType' characteristic

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text, and so forth

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: Regular expression to define constraint on the allowed value

@type.description: The class type of the characteristic value

@schemaLocation.description: Hyperlink reference to schema describing this object

TMF620RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

role.description: Role of the related party.

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

@referredType.description: The class type of referred party/party role reference

TMF620ProductSpecCharacteristic.description: A characteristic quality or distinctive feature of a ProductSpecification.  The characteristic can be take on a discrete value, such as color, can take on a range of values, (for example, sensitivity of 100-240 mV), or can be derived from a formula (for example, usage time (hrs) = 30 - talk time *3). Certain characteristics, such as color, may be configured during the ordering or some other process.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the productSpecCharacteristic is

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the productSpecCharacteristic is configurable

validFor.description: The period for which the productSpecCharacteristic is valid

@type.description: the class type of this characteristic

@schemaLocation.description: hyperlink reference to the schema describing this characteristic

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality

isUnique.description: An indicator that specifies if a value is unique for the specification. Possible values are; "unique while value is in effect" and "unique whether value is in effect or not"

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular expression used to derive the value of a characteristic value

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for a product

TMF620ServiceSpecificationRef.description: Service specification reference: ServiceSpecification(s) required to realize a ProductSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of the service specification

@referredType.description: the class type of associated service specification

TMF620TargetProductSchemaRef.description: The reference object to the schema and type of target product which is described by product specification

@referredType.description: class type of the target product

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing the target product

TMF620ProductSpecificationRelationship.description: A migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among product specifications.

id.description: Unique identifier of the productSpecification

type.description: Type of relationship such as migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

validFor.description: The period for which the productSpecificationRelationship is valid

TMF620ResourceSpecificationRef.description: Resource Specification reference: The ResourceSpecification is required to realize a ProductSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource specification

@referredType.description: the class type of associated resource specification

TMF620BundledProductSpecification.description: A type of ProductSpecification that belongs to a grouping of ProductSpecifications made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product specification

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

@type.description: the class type of the corresponding product specification

TMF620ProductSpecCharRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among productSpecCharacteristics.

type.description: Type of relationship such as aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

validFor.description: The period for which the productSpecCharRelationship is valid

charSpecSeq.description:
The order in which a CharacteristicSpecification appears within another CharacteristicSpecification that defines a grouping of CharacteristicSpecifications.

For example, a grouping may represent the name of an individual. The given name is first, the middle name is second, and the last name is third.

id.description: the identifier of the associated product specification

name.description: Name of the target product specification characteristic

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target product specification

@type.description: Class type of target product specification

TMF620ProductOfferingRef.description: ProductOffering reference. A product offering represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product offering

@referredType.description: the class type of the referred product offering

TMF620BundledPopRelationship.description: this object represents a bundle relationship from a bundle product offering (parent) to a simple product offering (child). A simple product offering may participate in more than one bundle relationships.

id.description: Unique identifier of the associated product offering

href.description: hyperlink reference of the associated product offering

name.description: Name of  the associated product offering

@type.description: (Class) type of the associated product offering

id.description: Unique identifier of the associated product offering

href.description: hyperlink reference of the associated product offering

name.description: Name of  the associated product offering

@type.description: (Class) type of the associated product offering

TMF620ConstraintRef.description: Constraint reference. The Constraint resource represents a policy/rule applied to an entity or entity spec.

id.description: reference id to the target constraint

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target constraint

@referredType.description: The (class) type of the referred constraint

TMF620PricingLogicAlgorithm.description: The PricingLogicAlgorithm entity represents an instantiation of an interface specification to external rating function (without a modeled bahavior in SID). Some of the parameters of the interface definiition may be already set (such as price per unit) and some may be gathered during the rating process from the event (such as call duration) or from ProductCharacteristicValues (such as assigned bandwidth)

id.description: unique id of the PLA

validFor.description: The period for which the PLA is valid

@type.description: The class type of this PLA

TMF620Tax.description: An amount of money levied on the price of a Product by a legislative body.

taxCategory.description: A categorization of the tax rate.

id.description: Id of the listener

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.

TMF621TroubleTicket.description: A trouble ticket is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by a trouble ticket management system

id.description: Unique identifier of the trouble ticket

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the trouble ticket entity

name.description: Name of the trouble ticket, typically a short description provided by the user that create the ticket

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

ticketType.description: represent a business type of the trouble ticket e.g. incident, complain, request

creationDate.description: The date on which the trouble ticket was created

lastUpdated.description: The date and time that the trouble ticked was last updated

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

status.description: The current status of the trouble ticket

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

TMF621TroubleTicket_Create.description:
A trouble ticket is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by a trouble ticket management system
Skipped properties: id,href

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

creationDate.description: The date on which the trouble ticket was created

lastUpdated.description: The date and time that the trouble ticked was last updated

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

status.description: The current status of the trouble ticket

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

TMF633ServiceCatalog.description:
The root entity for service catalog management.
A service catalog is a group of service specifications made available through service candidates that an organization provides to the consumers (internal consumers like its employees or B2B customers or B2C customers). 
A service catalog typically includes name, description and time period that is valid for. It will have a list of ServiceCandidate catalog items. A ServiceCandidate is an entity that makes a ServiceSpecification available to a catalog.
A ServiceCandidate and its associated ServiceSpecification may be "published" - made visible -in any number of ServiceCatalogs, or in none.

id.description: Unique identifier of the Catalog

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of catalog. For service catalogs, this will be 'ServiceCatalog'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: Indicates the base (class) type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which the catalog is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

TMF633ServiceSpecification.description:
ServiceSpecification is a class that offers characteristics to describe a type of service.
Functionally, it acts as a template by which Services may be instantiated. By sharing the same  specification, these services would therefore share the same set of characteristics.

TMF633Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

id.description: Unique identifier of the attachment

type.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

TMF633ServiceSpecCharacteristic.description: This class represents the key features of this service specification. For example, bandwidth is a characteristic of many different types of services; if bandwidth is a relevant characteristic (e.g., from the point-of-view of a Customer obtaining this Service via a Product) then bandwidth would be a ServiceSpecCharacteristic for that particular Service.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which this characteristic specification is known and distinguished from other characteristic specifications.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the ServiceSpecCharacteristic is

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the ServiceSpecCharacteristic is configurable

validFor.description: The period for which the ServiceSpecCharacteristic is valid

@type.description: (Class) type of the ServiceSpecCharacteristic

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this characteristic

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

isUnique.description: An indicator that specifies if a value is unique for the specification. Possible values are; "unique while value is in effect" and "unique whether value is in effect or not"

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular expression used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for an Entity.

TMF633ServiceSpecRelationship.description: A migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among service specifications.

type.description: Type of relationship such as migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

role.description: The association role for this service specification

id.description: Unique identifier of target ServiceSpecification

name.description: The name given to the target service specification instance

validFor.description: The period for which the ServiceSpecRelationship is valid

TMF633TargetServiceSchemaRef.description: The reference object to the schema and type of target service which is described by service specification

@type.description: Class type of the target service

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing the target service

TMF633ServiceSpecCharacteristicValue.description: A ServiceSpecCharacteristicValue object is used to define a set of attributes, each of which can be assigned to a corresponding set of attributes in a ServiceSpecCharacteristic object. The values of the attributes in the ServiceSpecCharacteristicValue object describe the values of the attributes that a corresponding ServiceSpecCharacteristic object can take on.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic value can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

isDefault.description: If true, the Boolean Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

value.description: the  value that the characteristic can take on.

unitOfMeasure.description: A length, surface, volume, dry measure, liquid measure, money, weight, time, and the like. In general, a determinate quantity or magnitude of the kind designated, taken as a standard of comparison for others of the same kind, in assigning to them numerical values, as 1 foot, 1 yard, 1 mile, 1 square foot.

validFor.description: The period of time for which a value is applicable.

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: A regular expression constraint for given value

@type.description: The class type of the characteristic value

@schemaLocation.description: Hyperlink reference to schema describing this object.

TMF633ServiceSpecCharRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Specification Characteristics.

type.description: Type of relationship such as aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

id.description: Unique identifier of the target specification

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target specification

@type.description: class type of target specification

validFor.description: The period for which the object is valid

id.description: Id of the listener

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.

TMF634ResourceSpecification.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is an abstract base class for representing a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of this REST resource

href.description: Hyperlink reference to this REST resource

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

@type.description: Class type of this REST resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: The (immediate) base class type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which this REST resource is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update of this REST resource

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of the resource specification

isBundle.description: A flag indicates that if this resource specification is a bundled specification (true) or single (false).

category.description: Category of the target resource like NetworkConnectivity, PhysicalLinks, Generic, L2Network and so on.

model.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the general type and/or category of the hardware item. This, in combination with the Part and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

part.description: This is a string that defines a manufacturer-allocated part number assigned by the organization that manufactures the hardware item. This, in combination with the Model and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

sku.description: This is a string that defines the manufacturer-allocated Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number of the hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

vendor.description: This is a string that defines the name of the manufacturer. This, in combination with the Model and the Part, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute for a physical resource.

TMF634ImportJob.description: Represents a task used to import resources from a file

id.description: Identifier of the import job

contentType.description: Indicates the format of the imported data

path.description: URL of the root resource where the content of the file specified by the import job must be applied

status.description: Status of the import job (not started, running, succeeded, failed)

url.description: URL of the file containing the data to be imported

completionDate.description: Date at which the job was completed

creationDate.description: Date at which the job was created

errorLog.description: Reason for failure if status is failed

TMF634TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

TMF634RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

role.description: Role of the related party.

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

TMF634CategoryRef.description: Category reference. The category resource is used to group product offerings, service and resource candidates in logical containers. Categories can contain other categories and/or product offerings, resource or service candidates.

id.description: Unique reference of the category

TMF634ResourceCandidateRef.description: ResourceCandidate reference: A resource candidate is an entity that makes a ResourceSpecification available to a catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource candidate

TMF634ResourceSpecificationRef.description: Resource Specification reference: The ResourceSpecification is required to realize a ProductSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource specification

TMF634TargetResourceSchemaRef.description: The reference object to the schema and type of target resource which is described by resource specification

@type.description: Class type of the target resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing the target resource

TMF634Feature.description: applicable feature(s) for this resource specification.

id.description: reference id to the feature. It is optional if the feature is not defined as a stand-alone object.

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target feature. It is optional if the feature is not defined as a separate REST resource.

name.description: Unique name given to the feature. it is Required if the feature is not introduced as a separate REST resource

@type.description: The optional (class) type of the feature

isBundle.description: A flag indicating if the feature is bundle (true) or not (false).

validFor.description: The period for which this relationship is valid

isEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the feature is enabled (true) or not (false).

TMF634Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

id.description: Unique identifier of the attachment

type.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

TMF634ResourceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This class defines the characteristic features of a resource specification. Every ResourceSpecification has a variety of important attributes, methods, constraints, and
relationships, which distinguish a resource specification from other resource specifications.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which this characteristic specification is known and distinguished from other characteristic specifications.

description.description: A narrative that explains the CharacteristicSpecification.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the ResourceSpecCharacteristic is configurable

validFor.description: The period of time for which a characteristic is applicable.

@type.description: (Class) type of the ResourceSpecCharacteristic

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this characteristic specification

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

isUnique.description: An indicator that specifies if a value is unique for the specification. Possible values are; "unique while value is in effect" and "unique whether value is in effect or not"

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular expression used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for a resource.

TMF634ResourceSpecRelationship.description: A migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among resource specifications.

type.description: Type of relationship such as migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

role.description: The association role for this resource specification

id.description: Unique identifier of target ResourceSpecification

name.description: The name given to the target resource specification instance

validFor.description: The period for which the ResourceSpecRelationship is valid

TMF634ResourceSpecCharRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Specification Characteristics.

type.description: Type of relationship such as aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

id.description: Unique identifier of the target specification

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target specification

@type.description: class type of target specification

validFor.description: The period for which the object is valid

TMF634ResourceSpecCharacteristicValue.description: A number or text that can be assigned to a ResourceSpecCharacteristic.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic value can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

isDefault.description: If true, the Boolean Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

value.description: The value that the characteristic can take on. If the value is a complex type, the definition of the type should be found by the link as defined in @schemaLocation

unitOfMeasure.description: A length, surface, volume, dry measure, liquid measure, money, weight, time, and the like. In general, a determinate quantity or magnitude of the kind designated, taken as a standard of comparison for others of the same kind, in assigning to them numerical values, as 1 foot, 1 yard, 1 mile, 1 square foot.

validFor.description: The period of time for which a value is applicable.

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: A regular expression constraint for given value

@type.description: The class type of a complex value type

@schemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type

TMF634PlaceRef.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

id.description: Unique identifier of the place

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as "Paris Store", "London Store", "Main Home"

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'home delivery', 'shop retrieval')

id.description: Id of the listener

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.

TMF637Product.description:
A Product represents the subscription of a ProductOffering by a Party playing a PartyRole, such as a Customer.  For example, Jean has subscribed to company ABCs internet ProductOffering.
The association between ProductSpecification and Product allows ProductSpecification, to be instantiated as Product and related to customers or other involved parties.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product

description.description: The description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer

name.description: The name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the Product Offering

productSerialNumber.description: Serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: The date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: The date when the product was terminated. Not applicable to active products

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. Here can be 'Product'

@type.description: Indicated the type of resource.

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST resource.

TMF637ProductOfferingRef.description: ProductOffering reference. A product offering represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product offering

@referredType.description: Type (class) of the product offering

TMF637ProductSpecification.description: A ProductSpecification is a detailed description of a tangible or intangible object made available externally in the form of a ProductOffering to customers or other parties playing a party role.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product specification

@referredType.description: Indicate the productSpecification type class

TMF637ProductCharacteristic.description: Characteristics of the product to instantiate or to modify.

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provided a link to the schema describing this REST resource.

TMF637ProductRelationship.description:
Type of the product relationship. it can be 'bundled' if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the 'bundled' products inside this bundle, 'reliesOn' if the product needs another already owned product to rely on 
(e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product) or 'targets' or 'isTargeted' (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

type.description: Type of the product relationship

TMF637BillingAccountRef.description: A BillingAccount is a detailed description of a bill structure

id.description: Unique identier of the billing account

@referredType.description: Indicates the (class) type of the billing account

TMF637RelatedParty.description: The party which the product is related with.

id.description: Unique identifier of the related party

role.description: Role played by the related party

@referredType.description: Indicates the (class) type of party

TMF637RealizingResource.description: RealizingResource reference. RealizingResource is a link to the resource that realizes the product.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource

role.description: Role of the resource

@referredType.description: Indicate the class (type) of the realizing resource

TMF637RealizingService.description: RealizingService reference. RealizingService is a link to the service that realizes the product.

id.description: Unique identifier of the service

role.description: Role of the realizing service

@referredType.description: Indicate the class (type) of the realizing service.

TMF637ProductPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that represents the actual price paid by a Customer for a purchase, a rent or a lease of a Product. The price is valid for a defined period of time.

id.description: Unique identifier of a productOfferingPrice

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price"

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this product price

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth

@type.description: Indicates the type of ProductPrice class

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST resource

TMF637Price.description: Provides all amounts (tax included, duty free, tax rate), used currency and percentage applied for price and price alteration

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of the price

@schemaLocation.description: Link to the schema describing this REST resource.

TMF637TimePeriod.description: A time period described through 2 dates

TMF637ProductRef.description: A product reference to be used for relationship target

id.description: Unique identifier of the product

TMF637Place.description: Place defines the places where the products is installed or has a footprint (a place could be used for geo fencing

id.description: Unique identifier of the place

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'installation site', 'A-extremity site', 'Supervised Perimeter' etc...)

@referredType.description: Indicate the type of Place class (example: 'geographicAddress')

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST resource

TMF637PriceAlteration.description: Is an amount, usually of money, that modifies the price charged for a Product

id.description: Link to the schema describing this REST resource.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Monthly discount"

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this ProdPriceAlteration

priceType.description: A category that describes the price such as recurring, one shot and so forth

priority.description: Priority level for applying this alteration among all the defined alterations

@type.description: Indicated the class (type) of the price alteration.

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing the price alteration.

TMF637Hub.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics

id.description: Unique identifier of the hub

callback.description: The callback address to be registered

TMF637HubInput.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics

callback.description: The callback address to be registered

TMF637ProductOrderRef.description: The product order(s) related to this product inventory

id.description: Unique identifier of product order

href.description: Hypertext Reference of the product order

@referredType.description: Indicate the class (type) of productOrder

orderItemId.description: Identifier of the order item where the product was managed

orderItemAction.description: Action of the order item for this product

TMF637ProductTerm.description: This represent a commitment with a duration

@type.description: Indicate the class (type) of the product term

TMF637Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money.

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency).

TMF637TargetResourceSchema.description: Target to the schema describing the product spec resource

@type.description: Indicated the type of the productSpec described there - for example an E-Line Spec, a CPE spec

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing the product spec

TMF637Quantity.description: Description of a quantity like for the Duration attribute

units.description: A unit associated with the quantity (for example months)

code.description: Application related code (as defined in the API or from a common list)

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error. This can be shown to a client user.

message.description: Text that provide more details and corrective actions related to the error. This can be shown to a client user.

status.description: http error code extension like 400-2

referenceError.description: url pointing to documentation describing the error

@type.description: The class type of a REST resource.

@schemaLocation.description: it provides a link to the schema describing a REST resource.

TMF638Service.description: Service is an abstract base class for defining the Service hierarchy. All Services are characterized as either being possibly visible and usable by a Customer or not. This gives rise to the two subclasses of Service: CustomerFacingService and ResourceFacingService.

id.description: Unique identifier of the service

type.description: Service type

category.description: Is it a customer facing or resource facing service

isServiceEnabled.description: For use. If the value of this attribute is FALSE, then this means that this particular Service has NOT been enabled for use

hasStarted.description: This is a Boolean attribute that, if TRUE, signifies that this Service has already been started. If the value of this attribute is FALSE, then this signifies that this Service has NOT been Started

startMode.description:
This attribute is an enumerated integer that indicates how the Service is started. Values include: 
0: Unknown 
1: Automatically by the managed environment 
2: Automatically by the owning device 
3: Manually by the Provider of the Service 
4: Manually by a Customer of the Provider 
5: Any of the above.

isStateful.description: This is a Boolean attribute that, if TRUE, means that this Service can be changed without affecting any other services

TMF638ServiceSpecificationRef.description: Service specification reference: ServiceSpecification(s) required to realize a ProductSpecification

id.description: Unique identifier of the service specification

name.description: Name of the required service specification

TMF638ServiceCharacteristic.description: A list of name value pairs that define the service characteristics

TMF638ServiceRelationship.description: Describes links with services of the same category (useful for bundled services)

type.description: Describes links with services of the same category (useful for bundled services)

TMF638SupportingService.description: A collection of services that support this service (links between CFS; RFS)

id.description: Unique identifier of the supporting service
Unique identifier of the supporting resource

TMF638RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

role.description: Role played by the related party

TMF638ServiceOrderRef.description: A Service Order is a request to perform an action on a specific Service and its contained services

id.description: Unique identifier of the related service order

href.description: Reference of the related service order

TMF638Place.description: Used to define a place useful for the service (for example a delivery geographical place)

href.description: Reference of a place (for instance in google map)

role.description: Role of the place (for instance delivery geographical place)

TMF638ServiceRef.description: Service reference. Useful to link services of the same category

id.description: Unique identifier of the service

TMF638Value.description: Structure used to describe characteristic value

TMF638Hub.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics

TMF638HubInput.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

manufactureDate.description: This is a string attribute that defines the date of manufacture of this item in the fixed format "dd/mm/yyyy". This is an optional attribute.

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

serialNumber.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify different instances of the same hardware item. The ModelNumber and PartNumber attributes are used to identify different types of hardware items. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

versionNumber.description: This is a string that identifies the version of this object. This is an optional attribute.

TMF653MeasureThresholdRuleViolation.description:
A measureThresholdRuleViolation is a violation of a rule that defines the in the 
MericDefMeasureThresholdRule.

conformanceComparatorLower.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to compare with the conformanceTargetLower.

conformanceComparatorUpper.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to compare with the conformanceTargetUpper.

conformanceTargetLower.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the lower limit. The value should be less than the conformanceTargetUpper. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

conformanceTargetUpper.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the Upper limit. The value should be greater than the conformanceTargetLower. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

numberOfAllowedCrossing.description:
The number of allowed crossing occurrences in reference to the 
tolerancePeriod without a consequence being initiated.

thresholdRuleSeverity.description:
A threshold can be generated in different severity levels. A 
crossing for each level may require a different condition and possibly trigger a different consequence.

tolerancePeriod.description:
An interval of time of allowed crossing occurrences before a 
consequence being initiated.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

TMF653AppliedConsequence.description:
An Applied Consequence defines the action (prescribed action or notification) to take when a 
MeasureThresholdRuleViolation occurs.

appliedAction.description:
The action for a violated threshold. This could be a hyperlink to 
the action.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the consequence is.

name.description:
A word, term, or phrase by which Consequence is known and 
distinguished from other MetricDefMeasureConsequences.

repeatAction.description:
An indicator use to specify that a consequence should cease 
being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value or continue being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value.  
If the repeatAcation is True, if the consequence is always applied as soon as the MetricMeasure value is in the range of values and if the repeatAcation is False, the consequence is applied only if the previous MetricMeasure value wasnt in the same range.

TMF653MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule.description:
A MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule is a rule that defines the condition (raise or clear) to achieve to apply 
consequences when a threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. It also defines the severity of the 
raise or clear of the threshold.

conformanceComparatorLower.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to Service Test Management API REST Specification compare with the conformanceTargetLower.

conformanceComparatorUpper.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to compare with the conformanceTargetUpper.

conformanceTargetLower.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the lower limit. The value should be less than the conformanceTargetUpper. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

conformanceTargetUpper.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the Upper limit. The value should be greater than the conformanceTargetLower. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

numberOfAllowedCrossing.description:
The number of allowed crossing occurrences in reference to the 
tolerancePeriod without a consequence being initiated.

thresholdRuleSeverity.description:
A threshold can be generated in different severity levels. A 
crossing for each level may require a different condition and possibly trigger a different consequence.

tolerancePeriod.description: A String. An interval of time of allowed crossing occurrences before a consequence being initiated.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

TMF653MetricDefMeasureConsequence.description:
A MetricDefMeasureConsequence defines the action (prescribed action or notification) to take when a 
MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule is crossed.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the consequence is.

name.description:
A word, term, or phrase by which a 
MetricDefMeasureConsequence is known and distinguished from other MetricDefMeasureConsequences.

prescribeAction.description:
Recommended remedy for a violated threshold. This could be 
the hyperlink to the action.

repeatAction.description:
An indicator use to specify that a consequence should cease 
being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value  or continue being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value.   
If the repeatAcation is True, if the consequence is always applied as soon as the MetricMeasure value is in the range of values and if the repeatAcation is False, the consequence is applied only if the previous MetricMeasure value wasnt in the same range.

validFor.description: A valid duration of a thing.

id.description: Id of the listener

code.description: Application related code.

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error.

message.description: (optional) Text that provide more details and corrective actions related to the error.

status.description: (optional) http error code extension like 400-2

referenceError.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.
